critters.name: White-Tailed Deer
critters.summary: Common Michigan woodland browser frequently seen near feeders.
critters.fact: Deer shed and regrow antlers every year.

critters.name: Black Bear
critters.summary: Largest land mammal in Michigan forests.
critters.fact: Black bears can smell food over a mile away.

critters.name: Coyote
critters.summary: Adaptable predator often heard more than seen.
critters.fact: Coyotes can run around 40 mph.

critters.name: Red Fox
critters.summary: Solitary hunter common in fields and woods.
critters.fact: Foxes use Earthâ€™s magnetic field when hunting.

critters.name: Gray Squirrel
critters.summary: Tree-dwelling rodent common at feeders.
critters.fact: Squirrels forget some buried nuts, helping trees grow.

critters.name: Snowshoe Hare
critters.summary: Forest rabbit that changes color seasonally.
critters.fact: Their large feet act like snowshoes in winter.

critters.name: Raccoon
critters.summary: Nocturnal omnivore often visiting feeders.
critters.fact: Raccoons have extremely sensitive front paws.

critters.name: Opossum
critters.summary: North Americaâ€™s only marsupial.
critters.fact: Opossums help control ticks in the ecosystem.

critters.name: Striped Skunk
critters.summary: Nocturnal omnivore known for defensive spray.
critters.fact: Their spray can reach about 10 feet.

critters.name: Flying Squirrel
critters.summary: Small nocturnal gliding squirrel.
critters.fact: They glide using skin flaps between limbs.

critters.name: Blue Jay
critters.summary: Bold woodland songbird common at feeders.
critters.fact: Blue jays can mimic hawk calls.

critters.name: Northern Cardinal
critters.summary: Bright red bird active year-round.
critters.fact: Cardinals do not migrate.

critters.name: Black-Capped Chickadee
critters.summary: Small energetic feeder bird.
critters.fact: Chickadees lower body temp at night to conserve energy.

critters.name: Pileated Woodpecker
critters.summary: Large woodpecker often heard drumming.
critters.fact: They excavate large rectangular tree holes.

critters.name: Wild Turkey
critters.summary: Large ground bird common in Michigan.
critters.fact: Turkeys can fly short distances.

critters.name: Sandhill Crane
critters.summary: Tall wetland bird with distinctive call.
critters.fact: Cranes mate for life.

critters.name: Mallard Duck
critters.summary: Common pond and wetland duck.
critters.fact: Mallards can sleep with one eye open.

critters.name: Canada Goose
critters.summary: Migratory waterfowl often seen in flocks.
critters.fact: They fly in V formation to save energy.

critters.name: Great Blue Heron
critters.summary: Large wading bird near lakes and rivers.
critters.fact: Herons strike fish with lightning-fast neck thrusts.

critters.name: Painted Turtle
critters.summary: Common basking turtle.
critters.fact: They can survive low oxygen winter conditions.

critters.name: Spring Peeper
critters.summary: Tiny frog with loud spring call.
critters.fact: Often first amphibian heard after winter.

critters.name: Garter Snake
critters.summary: Common non-venomous snake.
critters.fact: Some garter snakes hibernate in large groups.

critters.name: Monarch Butterfly
critters.summary: Migratory butterfly species.
critters.fact: They travel thousands of miles annually.

critters.name: Dragonfly
critters.summary: Fast flying insect near water.
critters.fact: Dragonflies are aerial predators.
